intro: Andromeda adenothrix, commonly known as the narrowleaf sweetshrub, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are narrow and dark green, while its flowers range in color from white to pink, blooming in late spring. Andromeda adenothrix is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
